page.title: 10Computers in Schools
page.content: In the 1970's there was a slow introduction of computers into schools. Popular Machines were the Apple, Sinclair Spectrum and the BBC. Departments which got the machines were those that showed most interest in their potential use. Thus the dpartments of Maths, Geography, Chemistry, Physics received some of the first hardware. Software was the problem. Who would write the programs? The teachers? But when? Some working parties were set up and slowly software appeared most programs were less than 48K sadly there were only one or two machines per department (except maths) and so the use of computers was limited to really keen staff only. The use of chalk, talk the overhead projector and slides/film strips remained as the main teaching aids.
